item.title: The assassination of a presidential candidate in Ecuador shines a spotlight on the corrosive impact of a booming cocaine trade and the emboldened gangs fueling brutal violence.
item.description: The assassination of a presidential candidate in Ecuador shines a spotlight on the corrosive impact of a booming cocaine trade and the emboldened gangs fueling brutal violence.

item.title: Iran has slowed the pace at which it is accumulating near weapons-grade enriched uranium and has diluted some of its stockpile.
item.description: Iran has slowed the pace at which it is accumulating near weapons-grade enriched uranium and has diluted some of its stockpile.

item.title: A judge barred Donald Trump from publicizing sensitive evidence in the criminal case alleging that he conspired to undo his 2020 election loss, saying his presidential campaign doesn't mean he should get special treatment.
item.description: A judge barred Donald Trump from publicizing sensitive evidence in the criminal case alleging that he conspired to undo his 2020 election loss, saying his presidential campaign doesn’t mean he should get special treatment.

item.title: After Egypt agreed it wouldn't send weapons to Russia, it is now resisting requests from senior U.S. leaders to send them to Kyiv, Egyptian and American officials say.
item.description: After Egypt agreed it wouldn’t send weapons to Russia, it is now resisting requests from senior U.S. leaders to send them to Kyiv, Egyptian and American officials say.

item.title: Ukraine's Zelensky said he was firing the heads of regional draft boards in a bid to rid the system of corruption as the country's armed forces struggle to break through Russian positions.
item.description: Ukraine’s Zelensky said he was firing the heads of regional draft boards in a bid to rid the system of corruption as the country’s armed forces struggle to break through Russian positions.

item.title: Attorney General Garland named Delaware U.S. Attorney David Weiss as a special counsel to continue his prosecution of Hunter Biden after plea talks broke down, opening a new, politically fraught chapter in the long-running legal drama.
item.description: Attorney General Garland named Delaware U.S. Attorney David Weiss as a special counsel to continue his prosecution of Hunter Biden after plea talks broke down, opening a new, politically fraught chapter in the long-running legal drama.

item.title: Startups are dying amid a historic drought in venture funding, showing how an indispensable engine of Silicon Valley is suffering even as technology stocks rebound.
item.description: Startups are dying amid a historic drought in venture funding, showing how an indispensable engine of Silicon Valley is suffering even as technology stocks rebound.

item.title: Problems are mounting for China's largest surviving property developer, Country Garden, which expects its worst loss since going public.
item.description: Problems are mounting for China’s largest surviving property developer, Country Garden, which expects its worst loss since going public.

item.title: Viet Dinh is leaving his post as Fox's chief legal and policy officer at year's end.
item.description: Viet Dinh is leaving his post as Fox's chief legal and policy officer at year’s end.

item.title: A federal court dismissed a lawsuit accusing Starbucks executives and directors of violating their fiduciary duty to shareholders by supporting corporate diversity policies.
item.description: A federal court dismissed a lawsuit accusing Starbucks executives and directors of violating their fiduciary duty to shareholders by supporting corporate diversity policies.

item.description: What’s News: World-Wid

item.title: Shares of Nvidia, the graphics-chip maker at the heart of the frenzy over artificial intelligence, have nearly tripled in 2023, but some investors chalk the surge up to speculative mania.
item.description: Shares of Nvidia, the graphics-chip maker at the heart of the frenzy over artificial intelligence, have nearly tripled in 2023, but some investors chalk the surge up to speculative mania.

item.title: The summer stock market rally has started to cool as the Nasdaq fell 0.7% to a one-month low on Friday. The S&P 500 slid 0.1% and the Dow added 0.3%.
item.description: The summer stock market rally has started to cool as the Nasdaq fell 0.7% to a one-month low on Friday. The S&P 500 slid 0.1% and the Dow added 0.3%.

item.title: A federal judge revoked FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried's bail and sent him to jail, ending a battle between the DOJ and the onetime crypto entrepreneur over his behavior while he awaits trial on fraud charges.
item.description: A federal judge revoked FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried’s bail and sent him to jail, ending a battle between the DOJ and the onetime crypto entrepreneur over his behavior while he awaits trial on fraud charges.

item.title: How U.S. and China Are Breaking Up, in Charts
item.description: China’s share of U.S. imports hits a 20-year low, with Mexico and Canada becoming America’s top two trade partners.

item.title: China's Home Buyers Are Waiting Out the Property Slump
item.description: The wait-and-see attitude of home buyers is deepening the slump and complicating policy makers’ attempts to revive economic growth.

item.title: This 60-Year-Old Soviet Rocket Launcher Fights On in Ukraine
item.description: Vintage weapons are playing a pivotal role in backstopping Ukraine’s slow-moving counteroffensive. Few symbolize that reliance more than the BM-21 Grad.

item.title: The Fighting Wisdom of Bruce Lee
item.description: The actor and martial arts star also wanted to be regarded as a poet-philosopher.
